title: On the Formal Carlitz Module.pdf
abstract: . Let L/Fq(θ) be a ﬁnite extension, and let P be a monic irreducible polynomial in Fq[θ]. We show that the value at 1 of the Carlitz-Goss P -adic zeta-function attached to L/K is intimately connected to the module of Tael- man’s units (for the Carlitz module) associated to ﬁnite extension L. Introduction Let p be a prime number and let F be a totally real number ﬁeld. Let ζp,F be the p-adic Dedekind zeta function associated to F. In 1988 P. Colmez proved the following remarkable p-adic analytic class number formula ([9]) : lim s→1(s −1)ζp,F (s) = hF Y P|p (1 − 1 | OF P |) 2[F :Q]−1Rp,F √DF , where hF is the ideal class number of the ring of integers OF of F, P runs through the maximal ideals of OF above p, Rp,F is the p-adic regulator of F, DF is the discriminant of F. Our aim in these notes is to show how a slight variation of Tael- man’s class formula ([15]) for the Carlitz module enable us to prove an analogous formula for ”real” extensions of K := Fq(θ). Let A = Fq[θ], K = Fq(θ), K∞= Fq(( 1 θ)). Let L/K be a ﬁnite extension, let OL be the integral closure of A in L, and let L∞= L ⊗K K∞.
